meanings.definition: The quality or state of being disadvantageous.
meanings.sent1: The disadvantageousness of the situation made it difficult to succeed.
meanings.sent2: The team considered the disadvantageousness of starting the game without their star player.
meanings.sent3: Despite the disadvantageousness of the rainy weather, they decided to have a picnic indoors.
meanings.sent4: The disadvantageousness of the rocky terrain was like trying to walk on a bed of nails.
meanings.sent5: The disadvantageousness of the decision lingered in their minds long after it was made.

meanings.definition: The condition of being unfavorable or harmful.
meanings.sent1: She realized the disadvantageousness of skipping breakfast when she felt lightheaded.
meanings.sent2: The disadvantageousness of the new policy was evident in the drop in employee morale.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics added a touch of disadvantageousness to the otherwise peaceful household.
meanings.sent4: The disadvantageousness of the leaky roof became apparent during the heavy rainstorm.
meanings.sent5: The disadvantageousness of procrastination became clear when the deadline approached.
